com.nxp.id.jcopx
Class SecureBox

java.lang.Object
  com.nxp.id.jcopx.SecureBox

public class SecureBox
extends java.lang.Object

Secure Box JavaCard implementation to be used by a JavaCard applet. The Secure Box functionality uses dedicated memory areas that are provided or made accessible by functions of this class.

Since:
JCOP v2.4.2

Field Summary
static byte MAX_NUM_PERSISTENT_ARRAYS
          The maximum number of persistent arrays, that can be mapped into the memory space visible to the native library.

public static final byte MAX_NUM_PERSISTENT_ARRAYS
The maximum number of persistent arrays, that can be mapped into the memory space visible to the native library.

Method Detail

runNativeLib

public static final short runNativeLib(byte libraryID,
                                       byte functionID,
                                       java.lang.Object[] eepromArrays,
                                       byte[] ramInitializationArray,
                                       short ramInitializationArrayOffset,
                                       short ramInitializationArrayLength,
                                       byte[] cryptoramInitializationArray,
                                       short cryptoramInitializationArrayOffset,
                                       short cryptoramInitializationArrayLength,
                                       byte[] resultArray1,
                                       short resultArray1Offset,
                                       byte[] resultArray2,
                                       short resultArray2Offset)
                                throws SecureBoxException
Invokes the native library function.

Parameters:
libraryID - The identification number of the library.
functionID - This function ID is passed to the native library. The library can decide with this parameter, what branch it will access. It is not mandatory for the native library to make use of this parameter.
eepromArrays - The array contains the references to all EEPROM arrays, that can be accessed by the native library. At most MAX_NUM_PERSISTENT_ARRAYS can be mapped. Only the first MAX_NUM_PERSISTENT_ARRAYS indexes starting from index zero are searched for byte[] objects.
  • If eepromArrays contains more references to arrays than the maximum allowed number, all object references after index MAX_NUM_PERSISTENT_ARRAYS will be ignored without throwing an error.
  • If an object reference in the array is null, no mapping will be done.
  • If the object references an object different than a byte[] in EEPROM, an exception with reason SecureBoxException.INVALID_OBJECT will be thrown.
  • If one of the arrays has a length, that is not MMU granularity aligned, SecureBoxException.PERSISTENT_BYTE_ARRAY_WRONG_LENGTH is thrown.
  • If one of the arrays is located in transient memory, the exception with reason SecureBoxException.ARRAY_IS_NOT_MAPABLE is thrown.
  • If eepromArrays is null, no EEPROM arrays will be mapped to the native library.
  • The EEPROM arrays are mapped to one single memory block available for the native library.
  • The memory blocks are mapped to the native library in the same order as they are in eepromArrays.
ramInitializationArray - This array contains the initialization data, that is copied to the RAM memory part accessible by the native library right before the native library is called. If ramInitializationArray is null, RAM will not get initialized with data. The array can be located either in persistent or transient memory.
ramInitializationArrayOffset - Offset of initialization data in ramInitializationArray.
ramInitializationArrayLength - Number of bytes to copy from ramInitializationData to the RAM of the native library.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength is zero, no data is copied.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength is larger than the RAM accessible by the native library, an exception with reason SecureBoxException.INITIALIZATION_OVERFLOW is thrown.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength + ramInitializationDataOffset > ramInitializationData.length, an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
cryptoramInitializationArray - This array contains the initialization data, that is copied to the FXRAM memory part accessible by the native library right before the native library is called. If cryptoramInitializationArray is null, FXRAM will not get initialized with data. The array can be located either in persistent or transient memory.
cryptoramInitializationArrayOffset - Offset of initialization data in cryptoramInitializationArrayOffset.
cryptoramInitializationArrayLength - Number of bytes to copy from ramInitializationData to the RAM of the native library.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength is zero, no data is copied.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength is larger than the RAM accessible by the native library, an exception with reason SecureBoxException.INITIALIZATION_OVERFLOW is thrown.
  • If ramInitializationDataLength + ramInitializationDataOffset > ramInitializationData.length, an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
resultArray1 - Array to return calculation results back to the applet after the native library exits. It is the responsibility of the native library to decide, how many bytes will get copied into this array.
  • If resultArray1 is null, no data will be copied back even if data is provided by the native library.
  • If the native library wants to return more data than space is available in resultArray1, an SecureBoxException.RESULT_OVERFLOW is thrown.
  • If the array is located in EEPROM, a TransactionException can be thrown, if the native library wants the data to be copied as atomic operation
resultArray1Offset - Offset in resultArray1, where return data will be placed.
resultArray2 - Array to return calculation results back to the applet after the native library exits. It is the responsibility of the native library to decide, how many bytes will get copied into this array.
  • If resultArray2 is null, no data will be copied back even if data is provided by the native library.
  • If the native library wants to return more data than space is available in resultArray2, an SecureBoxException.RESULT_OVERFLOW is thrown.
  • If the array is located in EEPROM, a TransactionException can be thrown, if the native library wants the data to be copied as atomic operation
resultArray2Offset - Offset in resultArray2, where return data will be placed.
Throws:
SecureBoxException - in case of invalid parameter or malfunction of the native library.
